meanings.sent1: The balloon will rupture if you blow too much air into it.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to rupture the fragile bubble with too much pressure.
meanings.sent3: I hope my laughter doesn't rupture my sides!
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room was about to rupture with the loud sound of thunder.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the air was so thick, it felt like it could rupture at any moment.

meanings.definition: A breach or tear in a part of the body
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed him with a rupture in his muscle.
meanings.sent2: The athlete had to undergo surgery to repair the rupture in his Achilles tendon.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character's exaggerated rupture made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The rupture in the dam caused a flood of water to rush through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The rupture in the fabric of reality allowed for unexpected events to occur.

meanings.definition: A state of being broken or burst
meanings.sent1: The rupture of the dam led to widespread flooding in the area.
meanings.sent2: The rupture of trust between them was irreparable.
meanings.sent3: The rupture in the friendship was unexpected but necessary.
meanings.sent4: The rupture of the silence with her loud voice startled everyone.
meanings.sent5: The rupture of the storm clouds brought a downpour of rain.
